name: Ball Breaker (prasinShrestha)
description:
Ball Breaker builds on the breaker genre and adds DOTweens in certain aspects of the game. 

The game has 5 levels and needs to be played in order. You need not to complete or beat the preceding level. The objective is to score as high as you can by the end of the 5 levels. Whether you complete or fail each level is irrelevant. 

You shoot the ball with Space and move your paddle with A/D or left/right. Don’t forget to play the BGM at the beginning. The entire game should take you no more than 5 mins.

The game adds different scenes for each level. There is the use of singletons, that keep note of points you scored, bricks you broke (regardless if you win or fail each level), and the number of levels you beat. The stats will be shown at the end. The only pickup is health, which only adds your attempts to play each level. Don’t be afraid to lose lives. The game is fast-paced, so play recklessly. Get as high a score in each level as you can. You have special bricks that require more than 1 hit to break. Of course, focusing on these bricks will only consume time. 

There is a handful of tweening in the game. It is there to bring life to it, but not lose the visual fidelity. You will find this tweening to be less noticeable, as most of the action that happens gets your attention.
